$:/plugins/benwebber/dnd/Changelog.title: $:/plugins/benwebber/dnd/Changelog
$:/plugins/benwebber/dnd/Changelog.text:
\define unreleased() [[Unreleased|https://github.com/benwebber/tiddlywiki-dnd/compare/v$(latest)$..HEAD]]
\define issue(number) [[#$number$|https://github.com/benwebber/tiddlywiki-dnd/issues/$number$]]
\define release(version) [[$version$|https://github.com/benwebber/tiddlywiki-dnd/releases/tag/v$version$]]

<$vars latest={{$:/plugins/benwebber/dnd!!version}}>

! <<unreleased>>
</$vars>

! <<release 1.1.0>> (2019-02-15)

!! Added

* Added `dnd.attack` macro to typeset creature melee and ranged attacks.
* Added `dnd.modifier` macro to calculate ability score modifiers independently.

!! Changed

* Make creature and spell tags configurable (<<issue 3>>).
* Refactored localization code to work with core language switcher. Nearly all user-facing strings use this framework now (<<issue 2>>).

!! Deprecated

* Deprecated `dnd.dspell` and `dnd.fspell` in favour of a single template that determines the input tiddler's type. These templates will be removed in 2.0.0.
* Deprecated `dnd.dstatblock` and `dnd.fstatblock` in favour of a single template that determines the input tiddler's type. These templates will be removed in 2.0.0.

!! Fixed

* `dnd.check` macro supports skills with spaces in the name (Animal Handling and Sleight of Hand).
* Macros which expect boolean values now only consider the string "true" true (<<issue 5>>).

! <<release 1.0.0>> (2018-08-31)

!! Added

* Added English (UK) and English (US) translations.
* Added D&D icon from Font Awesome to plugin info block.
* Set up Jest test harness, Travis CI, and Codecov.
* Added creature view template.
* Added spell macros, templates, and view templates.
* Added toolbar buttons to create new creatures and spells.
* Added modal update form for creatures and spells.

!! Changed

* Moved macro functionality to testable library.
* Ported to ~TypeScript.
* Store creature attributes as tiddler field values by default.

!! Fixed

* Use proper minus sign for ability/roll modifiers.
* `dnd.average`: Pass through unrecognized roll expressions (support arbitrary values).

! <<release 0.1.0>> (2018-07-31)

Initial release.

$:/plugins/benwebber/dnd/README.title: $:/plugins/benwebber/dnd/README
$:/plugins/benwebber/dnd/README.text:
Manage //Dungeons & Dragons// campaigns with [[TiddlyWiki|https://tiddlywiki.com]].

! Install

[[Manually install|https://tiddlywiki.com/#Manually%20installing%20a%20plugin]] the plugin by dragging this link to your ~TiddlyWiki:

<$list
  filter="[<transclusion>prefix[{$:/plugins/benwebber/dnd/README|$:/plugins/benwebber/dnd/README|||}]]"
  emptyMessage="[[$:/plugins/benwebber/dnd]]"
>
{{$:/plugins/benwebber/dnd||$:/core/ui/Components/plugin-info}}
</$list>

Then save and refresh your ~TiddlyWiki.

! Quick Start

!! Create a new creature

<!-- Set variables to render button as it appears in the toolbar. -->
<$vars tv-config-toolbar-text="yes" tv-config-toolbar-class="">
Enable the {{$:/plugins/benwebber/dnd/ui/Buttons/new-creature}} tool to create new creature tiddlers with a single click.
</$vars>

See [[Goblin]] as an example.

!! Create a new spell

<!-- Set variables to render button as it appears in the toolbar. -->
<$vars tv-config-toolbar-text="yes" tv-config-toolbar-class="">
Enable the {{$:/plugins/benwebber/dnd/ui/Buttons/new-spell}} tool to create new spell tiddlers with a single click.
</$vars>

See [[Alarm]] as an example.

! Configuration

Navigate to the plugin info tiddler ([[$:/plugins/benwebber/dnd]]), then go to the ''Settings'' tab.

! Macros

!! `dnd.ability`

Renders an [[ability score|https://roll20.net/compendium/dnd5e/Ability%20Scores]] with its calculated modifier.

|! Call|! Output|
|`<<dnd.ability 8>>`|<<dnd.ability 8>>|
|`<<dnd.ability 10>>`|<<dnd.ability 10>>|
|`<<dnd.ability 15>>`|<<dnd.ability 15>>|
|`<<dnd.ability 20>>`|<<dnd.ability 20>>|

!! `dnd.attack`

Renders creature attacks.

!!! Attack and damage types

Attack types and damage types are localized strings.

To specify an attack's type, use the following values:

|! Value|! Attack Type|
|`melee`|<<dnd._lingo StatBlock/Action/Melee>>|
|`ranged`|<<dnd._lingo StatBlock/Action/Ranged>>|
|`both`|<<dnd._lingo StatBlock/Action/MeleeOrRanged>>|

Similarly, to specify an attack's damage type, use its English name.

|! Value|! Damage Type|
|`acid`|<<dnd._lingo Damage/Type/Acid>>|
|`bludgeoning`|<<dnd._lingo Damage/Type/Bludgeoning>>|
|`cold`|<<dnd._lingo Damage/Type/Cold>>|
|`fire`|<<dnd._lingo Damage/Type/Fire>>|
|`force`|<<dnd._lingo Damage/Type/Force>>|
|`lightning`|<<dnd._lingo Damage/Type/Lightning>>|
|`necrotic`|<<dnd._lingo Damage/Type/Necrotic>>|
|`piercing`|<<dnd._lingo Damage/Type/Piercing>>|
|`poison`|<<dnd._lingo Damage/Type/Poison>>|
|`psychic`|<<dnd._lingo Damage/Type/Psychic>>|
|`radiant`|<<dnd._lingo Damage/Type/Radiant>>|
|`slashing`|<<dnd._lingo Damage/Type/Slashing>>|
|`thunder`|<<dnd._lingo Damage/Type/Thunder>>|

!!! Simple melee, ranged, or melee and ranged attacks

```
<<dnd.attack
  name:"Rapier"
  type:melee
  bonus:"+3"
  reach:"5 ft."
  damage:"1d8+1"
  damageType:piercing
>>
```

<<dnd.attack name:"Rapier" type:melee bonus:"+3" reach:"5 ft." damage:"1d8+1" damageType:piercing>>

```
<<dnd.attack
  name:"Heavy Crossbow"
  type:ranged
  bonus:"+2"
  range:"100/400 ft."
  damage:"1d10"
  damageType:piercing
>>
```

<<dnd.attack name:"Heavy Crossbow" type:ranged bonus:"+2" range:"100/400 ft." damage:"1d10" damageType:piercing>>

```
<<dnd.attack
  name:"Dagger"
  type:both
  bonus:"+5"
  reach:"5 ft."
  range:"20/60 ft."
  damage:"1d4+3"
  damageType:piercing
>>
```

<<dnd.attack name:"Dagger" type:both bonus:"+5" reach:"5 ft." range:"20/60 ft." damage:"1d4+3" damageType:piercing>>

!!! Attacks with extra damage

```
<<dnd.attack
  name:"Greatsword"
  type:melee
  bonus:"+15"
  reach:"5 ft."
  damage:"4d6+8"
  damageType:"slashing"
  extraDamage:"6d8"
  extraDamageType:radiant
>>
```

<<dnd.attack name:"Greatsword" type:melee bonus:"+15" reach:"5 ft." damage:"4d6+8" damageType:slashing extraDamage:"6d8" extraDamageType:radiant>>

!!! Attacks with conditional damage

```
<<dnd.attack
  name:"Longsword"
  type:melee
  bonus:"+5"
  reach:"5 ft."
  damage:"1d8+3"
  damageType:slashing
  condDamage:"1d10+3"
  condDamageType:slashing
  when:"if used with two hands"
>>
```

<<dnd.attack name:"Longsword" type:melee bonus:"+5" reach:"5 ft." damage:"1d8+3" damageType:slashing condDamage:"1d10+3" condDamageType:slashing when:"if used with two hands">>

```
<<dnd.attack
  name:"Longsword"
  type:melee
  bonus:"+5"
  reach:"5 ft."
  damage:"1d8+3"
  damageType:slashing
  extraDamage:"1d4"
  extraDamage:fire
  condDamage:"1d10+3"
  condDamageType:slashing
  extraCondDamage:"1d4"
  extraCondDamage:fire
  when:"if used with two hands"
>>
```

<<dnd.attack name:"Longsword" type:melee bonus:"+5" reach:"5 ft." damage:"1d8+3" damageType:slashing extraDamage:"1d4" extraDamageType:fire condDamage:"1d10+3" condDamageType:slashing extraCondDamage:"1d4" extraCondDamageType:fire when:"if used with two hands">>

!!! Attacks with extra effects

```
<<dnd.attack
  name:"Light Crossbow"
  type:ranged
  bonus:"+6"
  range:"80/320 ft."
  damage:"1d8+3"
  damageType:piercing
  effect:"and the target must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 24 (7d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one"
>>
```

<<dnd.attack name:"Light Crossbow" type:ranged bonus:"+6" range:"80/320 ft." damage:"1d8+3" damageType:piercing effect:"and the target must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 24 (7d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one">>

!!! Attacks with special targets

```
<<dnd.attack
  name:"Dagger"
  type:both
  bonus:"+4"
  reach:"5 ft."
  range:"20/60 ft."
  target:"one creature"
  damage:"1d4+2"
  damageType:piercing
>>
```

<<dnd.attack name:"Dagger" type:both bonus:"+4" reach:"5 ft." range:"20/60 ft." target:"one creature" damage:"1d4+2" damageType:piercing>>

!! `dnd.average`

Calculates the average result of the specified roll.

|! Call|! Output|
|`<<dnd.average d8>>`|<<dnd.average d8>>|
|`<<dnd.average 2d8>>`|<<dnd.average 2d8>>|
|`<<dnd.average 2d8+2>>`|<<dnd.average 2d8+2>>|
|`<<dnd.average 2d8-2>>`|<<dnd.average 2d8-2>>|
|`<<dnd.average "2d8 + 2">>`|<<dnd.average "2d8 + 2">>|
|`<<dnd.average "2d8 - 2">>`|<<dnd.average "2d8 - 2">>|

!! `dnd.check`

Typeset an ability check, optionally including a skill and/or DC.
This macro is not case-sensitive.

The macro matches English abbreviations of the ability names:

| Ability | Code |h
|<<dnd._lingo Ability/STR>> |`str` |
|<<dnd._lingo Ability/DEX>> |`dex` |
|<<dnd._lingo Ability/CON>> |`con` |
|<<dnd._lingo Ability/INT>> |`int` |
|<<dnd._lingo Ability/WIS>> |`wis` |
|<<dnd._lingo Ability/CHA>> |`cha` |

It matches English skill names by least ambiguous prefix.
For example, `perc`, `perf`, and `pers` for Perception, Performance, and Persuasion, respectively.

| Skill | Least Ambiguous Prefix |h
|<<dnd._lingo Skill/Acrobatics>> |`ac` |
|<<dnd._lingo Skill/AnimalHandling>> |`an` |
|<<dnd._lingo Skill/Arcana>> |`ar` |
|<<dnd._lingo Skill/Athletics>> |`at` |
|<<dnd._lingo Skill/Deception>> |`d` |
|<<dnd._lingo Skill/History>> |`h` |
|<<dnd._lingo Skill/Insight>> |`ins` |
|<<dnd._lingo Skill/Intimidation>> |`int` |
|<<dnd._lingo Skill/Investigation>> |`inv` |
|<<dnd._lingo Skill/Medicine>> |`m` |
|<<dnd._lingo Skill/Nature>> |`n` |
|<<dnd._lingo Skill/Perception>> |`perc` |
|<<dnd._lingo Skill/Performance>> |`perf` |
|<<dnd._lingo Skill/Persuasion>> |`pers` |
|<<dnd._lingo Skill/Religion>> |`r` |
|<<dnd._lingo Skill/SleightOfHand>> |`sl` |
|<<dnd._lingo Skill/Stealth>> |`st` |
|<<dnd._lingo Skill/Survival>> |`su` |

You can also use the full skill name, such as `<<dnd.check dex acrobatics>>` or `<<dnd.check wis "Animal Handling">>`.

| Call | Output |h
|`<<dnd.check int>>` |<<dnd.check int>> |
|`<<dnd.check int dc:15>>` |<<dnd.check int dc:15>> |
|`<<dnd.check int inv>>` |<<dnd.check int inv>> |
|`<<dnd.check int inv 18>>` |<<dnd.check int inv 18>> |
|`<<dnd.check cha perf>>` |<<dnd.check cha perf>> |
|`<<dnd.check cha pers>>` |<<dnd.check cha pers>> |
|`<<dnd.check wis su>>` |<<dnd.check wis su>> |
|`<<dnd.check wis surv>>` |<<dnd.check wis surv>> |
|`<<dnd.check wis survival>>` |<<dnd.check wis survival>> |
|`<<dnd.check wis animal>>` |<<dnd.check wis animal>> |
|`<<dnd.check wis "Animal Handling">>` |<<dnd.check wis "Animal Handling">> |

Finally, the macro supports unusual ability and skill combinations, such as asking a player to make a <<dnd.check str int>> check (`<<dnd.check str int>>`).

!! `dnd.creature`

Helper macro to create a standalone creature tiddler.

This macro uses the [[dnd.statblock|$:/plugins/benwebber/dnd/templates/dnd.statblock]] template and stores the creature's attributes as tiddler fields.
It also adds a convenient button to edit the stats.

It is ''not'' necessary to use this macro if you use the automatic view template.

!! `dnd.modifier`

Calculates the modifier for a given ability score.

Generally you will want to use `dnd.ability` instead.

|! Call|! Output|
|`<<dnd.modifier 8>>`|<<dnd.modifier 8>>|
|`<<dnd.modifier 10>>`|<<dnd.modifier 10>>|
|`<<dnd.modifier 15>>`|<<dnd.modifier 15>>|
|`<<dnd.modifier 20>>`|<<dnd.modifier 20>>|

!! `dnd.spell`

Helper macro to create a standalone spell tiddler.

This macro uses the [[dnd.spell|$:/plugins/benwebber/dnd/templates/dnd.spell]] template and stores the spell's attributes as tiddler fields.
It also adds a convenient button to edit the attributes.

It is ''not'' necessary to use this macro if you use the automatic view template.

!! `dnd.statblock`

Render a creature stat block.
This is a low-level macro.
You may want to use the automatic view template instead (see below).

!!! Notes

* Ability scores default to <<dnd.ability 10>>.
* If not set, `language` defaults to `---`.

```
<<dnd.statblock
size: small
type: humanoid
tags: goblinoid
alignment: "neutral evil"
ac: "15 (leather armor, shield)"
hp: 2d6
speed: "30 ft."
str: 8
dex: 14
wis: 8
cha: 8
skills: "Stealth +6"
senses: "darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 9"
languages: "Common, Goblin"
challenge: 1/4
>>
```

<$reveal type="nomatch" state="!!dnd.statblock.state" text="show">

<$button set="!!dnd.statblock.state" setTo="show">Show</$button>

</$reveal>

<$reveal type="match" state="!!dnd.statblock.state" text="show">

<$button set="!!dnd.statblock.state" setTo="hide">Hide</$button>

<<dnd.statblock
size: small
type: humanoid
tags: goblinoid
alignment: "neutral evil"
ac: "15 (leather armor, shield)"
hp: 2d6
speed: "30 ft."
str: 8
dex: 14
wis: 8
cha: 8
skills: "Stealth +6"
senses: "darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 9"
languages: "Common, Goblin"
challenge: 1/4
>>

</$reveal>

!! `dnd.xp`

Renders experience points (XP) for the given challenge rating (CR).

!!! Standard challenge ratings

| Call | Output |h
|`<<dnd.xp 0>>`|<<dnd.xp 0>>|
|`<<dnd.xp 0 10>>`|<<dnd.xp 0 10>>|
|`<<dnd.xp 1/2>>`|<<dnd.xp 1/2>>|
|`<<dnd.xp 5>>`|<<dnd.xp 5>>|

!!! Custom challenge ratings

| Call | Output |h
|`<<dnd.xp 40>>` |<<dnd.xp 40>>|
|`<<dnd.xp 40 255555>>` |<<dnd.xp 40 255555>>|
|`<<dnd.xp unknown>>`|<<dnd.xp unknown>>|

! View Templates

~TiddlyWiki view templates automatically inject content into tiddlers that match certain criteria.
For example, you might use a view template to style all tiddlers with a certain tag.

This plugin ships with two view templates:

|! Template |! Description |! Example |
|`spell` |Automatically render a spell description for all tiddlers tagged <$link to={{$:/plugins/benwebber/dnd/config/Tags/Spells}}>{{$:/plugins/benwebber/dnd/config/Tags/Spells}}</$link>. |[[Alarm]] |
|`statblock` |Automatically render a stat block for all tiddlers tagged <$link to={{$:/plugins/benwebber/dnd/config/Tags/Creatures}}>{{$:/plugins/benwebber/dnd/config/Tags/Creatures}}</$link>. |[[Goblin]] |

Both templates are enabled by default.
To disable them and use the equivalent macros manually, navigate to the [[plugin settings tiddler|$:/plugins/benwebber/dnd]].

$:/plugins/benwebber/dnd/Settings.title: $:/plugins/benwebber/dnd/Settings
$:/plugins/benwebber/dnd/Settings.text:
\define render-boolean(key)
<$checkbox tiddler="$:/plugins/benwebber/dnd/config/$key$" field="text" checked="true" unchecked="false" default="true" />
\end

\define edit-setting(key)
<$edit-text tiddler="$:/plugins/benwebber/dnd/config/$key$" field="text" tag="input" />
\end

|<<dnd._lingo Settings/Version>> |{{$:/plugins/benwebber/dnd!!version}} |
|<<dnd._lingo Settings/CreatureTag>> |<<edit-setting "Tags/Creatures">> |
|<<dnd._lingo Settings/SpellTag>> |<<edit-setting "Tags/Spells">> |
|<<dnd._lingo Settings/RenderCreatures>> | <<render-boolean "ViewTemplates/StatBlock">> |
|<<dnd._lingo Settings/RenderSpells>> | <<render-boolean "ViewTemplates/Spell">> |

$:/plugins/benwebber/dnd/language/Settin.title: $:/plugins/benwebber/dnd/language/Settings/RenderCreatures
$:/plugins/benwebber/dnd/language/Settin.text: Automatically render stat blocks for creature tiddlers

$:/plugins/benwebber/dnd/language/Settin.title: $:/plugins/benwebber/dnd/language/Settings/RenderSpells
$:/plugins/benwebber/dnd/language/Settin.text: Automatically render stat blocks for spell tiddlers

$:/plugins/benwebber/dnd/macros/creature.title: $:/plugins/benwebber/dnd/macros/creature
$:/plugins/benwebber/dnd/macros/creature.text:
\define creature-actions()
<!--
If the user enters, then deletes a value in the form, the corresponding field
will be empty. Delete empty fields.
-->
<$list filter="[title<currentTiddler>fields[]]" variable="field">
<$list filter="[title<currentTiddler>!has<field>]">
<$action-deletefield $field=<<field>> />
</$list>
</$list>
<!-- Open editor form. -->
<$action-sendmessage
  $message="tm-modal"
  $param="$:/plugins/benwebber/dnd/ui/Modals/UpdateCreature"
  tiddler=<<currentTiddler>>
/>
\end

\define dnd.creature()
{{||$:/plugins/benwebber/dnd/templates/dnd.statblock}}

<$set name="sourceTiddler" value=<<currentTiddler>>>
<$button actions=<<creature-actions>>><<dnd._lingo EditCurrentTiddler>></$button>
</$set>
\end

$:/plugins/benwebber/dnd/macros/spell.title: $:/plugins/benwebber/dnd/macros/spell
$:/plugins/benwebber/dnd/macros/spell.text:
\define spell-actions()
<!--
If the user enters, then deletes a value in the form, the corresponding field
will be empty. Delete empty fields.
-->
<$list filter="[title<currentTiddler>fields[]]" variable="field">
<$list filter="[title<currentTiddler>!has<field>]">
<$action-deletefield $field=<<field>> />
</$list>
</$list>
<!-- Open editor form. -->
<$action-sendmessage
  $message="tm-modal"
  $param="$:/plugins/benwebber/dnd/ui/Modals/UpdateSpell"
  tiddler=<<currentTiddler>>
/>
\end

\define dnd.spell()
{{||$:/plugins/benwebber/dnd/templates/dnd.spell}}

<$set name="sourceTiddler" value=<<currentTiddler>>>
<$button actions=<<spell-actions>>><<dnd._lingo EditCurrentTiddler>></$button>
</$set>
\end

$:/plugins/benwebber/dnd/ui/Modals/Updat.title: $:/plugins/benwebber/dnd/ui/Modals/UpdateCreature
$:/plugins/benwebber/dnd/ui/Modals/Updat.subtitle: <<dnd._lingo Modals/Subtitle>>
$:/plugins/benwebber/dnd/ui/Modals/Updat.text:
\define input(field)
<$edit-text tag=input tiddler=<<tiddler>> field=<<__field__>> />
\end

\define select-size()
<$select tiddler=<<tiddler>> field="dnd.creature.size">
  <option value="tiny"><<dnd._lingo Creature/Size/Tiny>></option>
  <option value="small"><<dnd._lingo Creature/Size/Small>></option>
  <option value="medium"><<dnd._lingo Creature/Size/Medium>></option>
  <option value="large"><<dnd._lingo Creature/Size/Large>></option>
  <option value="huge"><<dnd._lingo Creature/Size/Huge>></option>
  <option value="gargantuan"><<dnd._lingo Creature/Size/Gargantuan>></option>
</$select>
\end

\define select-type()
<$select tiddler=<<tiddler>> field="dnd.creature.type">
  <option value="aberration"><<dnd._lingo Creature/Type/Aberration>></option>
  <option value="beast"><<dnd._lingo Creature/Type/Beast>></option>
  <option value="celestial"><<dnd._lingo Creature/Type/Celestial>></option>
  <option value="construct"><<dnd._lingo Creature/Type/Construct>></option>
  <option value="dragon"><<dnd._lingo Creature/Type/Dragon>></option>
  <option value="elemental"><<dnd._lingo Creature/Type/Elemental>></option>
  <option value="fey"><<dnd._lingo Creature/Type/Fey>></option>
  <option value="fiend"><<dnd._lingo Creature/Type/Fiend>></option>
  <option value="giant"><<dnd._lingo Creature/Type/Giant>></option>
  <option value="humanoid"><<dnd._lingo Creature/Type/Humanoid>></option>
  <option value="monstrosity"><<dnd._lingo Creature/Type/Monstrosity>></option>
  <option value="ooze"><<dnd._lingo Creature/Type/Ooze>></option>
  <option value="plant"><<dnd._lingo Creature/Type/Plant>></option>
  <option value="undead"><<dnd._lingo Creature/Type/Undead>></option>
</$select>
\end

\define select-ability(field)
<$select tiddler=<<tiddler>> field=<<__field__>>>
  <option value="1"><<dnd.ability 1>></option>
  <option value="2"><<dnd.ability 2>></option>
  <option value="3"><<dnd.ability 3>></option>
  <option value="4"><<dnd.ability 4>></option>
  <option value="5"><<dnd.ability 5>></option>
  <option value="6"><<dnd.ability 6>></option>
  <option value="7"><<dnd.ability 7>></option>
  <option value="8"><<dnd.ability 8>></option>
  <option value="9"><<dnd.ability 9>></option>
  <option value="10"><<dnd.ability 10>></option>
  <option value="11"><<dnd.ability 11>></option>
  <option value="12"><<dnd.ability 12>></option>
  <option value="13"><<dnd.ability 13>></option>
  <option value="14"><<dnd.ability 14>></option>
  <option value="15"><<dnd.ability 15>></option>
  <option value="16"><<dnd.ability 16>></option>
  <option value="17"><<dnd.ability 17>></option>
  <option value="18"><<dnd.ability 18>></option>
  <option value="19"><<dnd.ability 19>></option>
  <option value="20"><<dnd.ability 20>></option>
  <option value="21"><<dnd.ability 21>></option>
  <option value="22"><<dnd.ability 22>></option>
  <option value="23"><<dnd.ability 23>></option>
  <option value="24"><<dnd.ability 24>></option>
  <option value="25"><<dnd.ability 25>></option>
  <option value="26"><<dnd.ability 26>></option>
  <option value="27"><<dnd.ability 27>></option>
  <option value="28"><<dnd.ability 28>></option>
  <option value="29"><<dnd.ability 29>></option>
  <option value="30"><<dnd.ability 30>></option>
</$select>
\end

\define select-challenge()
<$select tiddler=<<tiddler>> field="dnd.creature.challenge">>
  <option value="0"><<dnd.xp "0">></option>
  <option value="0 10"><<dnd.xp "0" "10">></option>
  <option value="1/8"><<dnd.xp "1/8">></option>
  <option value="1/4"><<dnd.xp "1/4">></option>
  <option value="1/2"><<dnd.xp "1/2">></option>
  <option value="1"><<dnd.xp "1">></option>
  <option value="2"><<dnd.xp "2">></option>
  <option value="3"><<dnd.xp "3">></option>
  <option value="4"><<dnd.xp "4">></option>
  <option value="5"><<dnd.xp "5">></option>
  <option value="6"><<dnd.xp "6">></option>
  <option value="7"><<dnd.xp "7">></option>
  <option value="8"><<dnd.xp "8">></option>
  <option value="9"><<dnd.xp "9">></option>
  <option value="10"><<dnd.xp "10">></option>
  <option value="11"><<dnd.xp "11">></option>
  <option value="12"><<dnd.xp "12">></option>
  <option value="13"><<dnd.xp "13">></option>
  <option value="14"><<dnd.xp "14">></option>
  <option value="15"><<dnd.xp "15">></option>
  <option value="16"><<dnd.xp "16">></option>
  <option value="17"><<dnd.xp "17">></option>
  <option value="18"><<dnd.xp "18">></option>
  <option value="19"><<dnd.xp "19">></option>
  <option value="20"><<dnd.xp "20">></option>
  <option value="21"><<dnd.xp "21">></option>
  <option value="22"><<dnd.xp "22">></option>
  <option value="23"><<dnd.xp "23">></option>
  <option value="24"><<dnd.xp "24">></option>
  <option value="25"><<dnd.xp "25">></option>
  <option value="26"><<dnd.xp "26">></option>
  <option value="27"><<dnd.xp "27">></option>
  <option value="28"><<dnd.xp "28">></option>
  <option value="29"><<dnd.xp "29">></option>
  <option value="30"><<dnd.xp "30">></option>
</$select>
\end

<<dnd._lingo Modals/Help>>

|!<<dnd._lingo StatBlock/Size>> |<<select-size>> |
|!<<dnd._lingo StatBlock/Type>> |<<select-type>> |
|!<<dnd._lingo StatBlock/Tags>> |<<input dnd.creature.tags>> |
|!<<dnd._lingo StatBlock/Alignment>> |<<input dnd.creature.alignment>> |

| <<select-ability dnd.creature.str>> | <<select-ability dnd.creature.dex>> | <<select-ability dnd.creature.con>> | <<select-ability dnd.creature.int>> | <<select-ability dnd.creature.wis>> | <<select-ability dnd.creature.cha>> |

---

|!<<dnd._lingo StatBlock/SavingThrows>> |<<input dnd.creature.saves>> |

|!<<dnd._lingo StatBlock/DamageVulnerabilities>> |<<input dnd.creature.dvul>> |

|!<<dnd._lingo StatBlock/Challenge>> |<<select-challenge>> |

$:/plugins/benwebber/dnd/ui/Modals/Updat.title: $:/plugins/benwebber/dnd/ui/Modals/UpdateSpell
$:/plugins/benwebber/dnd/ui/Modals/Updat.subtitle: <<dnd._lingo Modals/Subtitle>>
$:/plugins/benwebber/dnd/ui/Modals/Updat.text:
\define input(field)
<$edit-text tag=input tiddler=<<tiddler>> field=<<__field__>> />
\end

\define select-level(field)
<$select tiddler=<<tiddler>> field="dnd.spell.level">
  <option>0</option>
  <option>1</option>
  <option>2</option>
  <option>3</option>
  <option>4</option>
  <option>5</option>
  <option>6</option>
  <option>7</option>
  <option>8</option>
  <option>9</option>
</$select>
\end

\define select-school()
<$select tiddler=<<tiddler>> field="dnd.spell.school">
  <option value="abjuration"><<dnd._lingo Spell/School/Abjuration>></option>
  <option value="conjuration"><<dnd._lingo Spell/School/Conjuration>></option>
  <option value="divination"><<dnd._lingo Spell/School/Divination>></option>
  <option value="enchantment"><<dnd._lingo Spell/School/Enchantment>></option>
  <option value="evocation"><<dnd._lingo Spell/School/Evocation>></option>
  <option value="illusion"><<dnd._lingo Spell/School/Illusion>></option>
  <option value="necromancy"><<dnd._lingo Spell/School/Necromancy>></option>
  <option value="transmutation"><<dnd._lingo Spell/School/Transmutation>></option>
</$select>
\end

<<dnd._lingo Modals/Help>>

|!<<dnd._lingo Spell/Level>> |<<select-level>> |
|!<<dnd._lingo Spell/School>> |<<select-school>> |
|!<<dnd._lingo Spell/CastingTime>> |<<input dnd.spell.cast>> <$checkbox tiddler=<<tiddler>> field="dnd.spell.ritual" checked="true" unchecked="" default=""> <<dnd._lingo Spell/Ritual>></$checkbox> |
|!<<dnd._lingo Spell/Range>> |<<input dnd.spell.range>> |
|!<<dnd._lingo Spell/Duration>> |<<input dnd.spell.duration>> |
|!<<dnd._lingo Spell/Components>> |<$checkbox tiddler=<<tiddler>> field="dnd.spell.verbal" checked="true" unchecked="" default=""> <<dnd._lingo Spell/Verbal>></$checkbox> <$checkbox tiddler=<<tiddler>> field="dnd.spell.somatic" checked="true" unchecked="" default=""> <<dnd._lingo Spell/Somatic>></$checkbox> <<dnd._lingo Spell/Material>>: <<input dnd.spell.material>> |

$:/plugins/benwebber/dnd/ui/ViewTemplate.title: $:/plugins/benwebber/dnd/ui/ViewTemplate/spell
$:/plugins/benwebber/dnd/ui/ViewTemplate.text:
<!-- Check tiddler tag. -->
<$list filter="[<currentTiddler>tag{$:/plugins/benwebber/dnd/config/Tags/Spells}]">
<!-- Check if user enabled view template; don't override <<currentTiddler>>. -->
<$list
  filter="[title[$:/plugins/benwebber/dnd/config/ViewTemplates/Spell]field:text[true]]"
  variable="noop"
>

<<dnd.spell>>
</$list>
</$list>

$:/plugins/benwebber/dnd/ui/ViewTemplate.title: $:/plugins/benwebber/dnd/ui/ViewTemplate/statblock
$:/plugins/benwebber/dnd/ui/ViewTemplate.text:
<!-- Check tiddler tag. -->
<$list filter="[<currentTiddler>tag{$:/plugins/benwebber/dnd/config/Tags/Creatures}]">
<!-- Check if user enabled view template; don't override <<currentTiddler>>. -->
<$list
  filter="[title[$:/plugins/benwebber/dnd/config/ViewTemplates/StatBlock]field:text[true]]"
  variable="noop"
>

<<dnd.creature>>
</$list>
</$list>
